quotes.quote: Be believing, be happy, don't get discouraged. Things will work out.
Believing is half the cure.
By believing passionately in something that still does not exist, we create it. The nonexistent is whatever we have not sufficiently desired.
Believing in people before they have proved themselves is the key to motivating people to reach their potential.
It's believing you can push through the exhaustion just to be able to sing after you do a cartwheel or a split.
Believing a person deserves a defence is not the same as doing anything in your power to get him off scot-free.
Believing in evolution is believing in the unproved, while believing in Christ is believing in the proven.
You just have to keep believing in yourself.
We are born believing. A man bears beliefs as a tree bears apples.
The first step to believing something is true is wanting to believe it is true... or being afraid it is.
If you're still believing, then you're almost there!
Believing in something and being a part of something you believe in and watching it work and coming from it.
Believing in who you are is a major part of a powerful combination for success.
Believing in progress does not mean believing that any progress has yet been made.
Find the good. It's all around you. Find it, showcase it and you'll start believing in it.
Why don't you start believing that no matter what you have or haven't done, that your best days are still out in front of you.
We've survived by believing our life is going to get better.
By virtue of believing in a Supreme Being one embraces certain mysteries.
When you start believing you're something special, then you're not going to be striving to move forward.
Believing you're something that you're not excites the mind and the imagination. And it's hopeful.
Believe it can be done. When you believe something can be done, really believe, your mind will find the ways to do it. Believing a solution paves the way to solution.
I rarely believe anything, because at the time of believing I am not really there to believe.
Perhaps believing in good design is like believing in God, it makes you an optimist.
Believing hath a core of unbelieving.
When you want to believe in something, you also have to believe in everything that's necessary for believing in it.
Not believing has a sickness which is believing a little.
Believing is easier than thinking. Hence so many more believers than thinkers.
Believing in Hell must distort every judgement on this life.
I think there is something, more important than believing: Action! The world is full of dreamers, there aren't enough who will move ahead and begin to take concrete steps to actualize their vision.
The very act of believing creates strength of its own.
The brute necessity of believing something so long as life lasts does not justify any belief in particular.
You can have anything you want if you will give up the belief that you can't have it.
You live as you believe. If you believe you can fly, you can fly.
Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.

Sometimes you cannot believe what you see, you have to believe what you feel. And if you are ever going to have other people trust you, you must feel that you can trust them, too--even when you're in the dark. Even when you're falling.
I just try to be the best I can be and hope that is the best ever.
Believing in yourself is the first secret to success.
Believing everyone is dangerous, but believing nobody is more dangerous.
Believing in yourself, is an endless destination. Believing you have failed. is the end of your journey.
Until you start believing in yourself, you aint gonna have a life!
No matter how your heart is grieving, if you keep on believing, the dream that you wish will come true.
Just believe in yourself. Even if you don't, pretend that you do and, at some point you will.
Never stop believing in hope because miracles happen everyday.
Believing that your competition is stronger and better than you pushes you to better yourselves.
Believing: it means believing in our own lies. And I can say that I am grateful that I got this lesson very early.
When men stop believing in God, it isn't that they then believe in nothing: they believe in everything.
There is no greater level and form of belief than believing in yourself.
In believing too much in rationality, our contemporaries have lost something.
You have to go into each match believing you can beat all of the players.
Believing in God is a very intense inner struggle of mine. It's something I worry about a lot, but which I don't have the answer to.
